</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="6%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">7</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="12%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">124%</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="12%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">126%</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="52%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Loan-to-value ratio on mortgage stock (indexed)</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="6%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">8</font></div>
</td>

</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="12%">

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="52%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Risk weighted assets</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="6%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">9</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">67,913</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">67,438</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">1.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading revenues</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading revenues comprise net interest income and non-interest income. Discussion and analysis of this data is set out in the Business Review on pages 10 to 17.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews trading revenues in order to assess the Group&#8217;s effectiveness in obtaining new customers and business. Management&#8217;s target for trading revenues has been growth of between 5% and 10% per annum. The increase of 5.7% for the six months ended 30 June 2010 was towards the lower end of this range, reflecting the low interest rate environment, cost of medium-term funding and cost of higher liquidity holdings, which are expected to continue to impact future periods.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">2.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading cost-to-income ratio</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">The trading cost-to-income ratio is defined as trading expenses divided by trading income. Discussion and analysis of trading income and expenses is set out in the Business Review on pages 10 to 17.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews the trading cost-to-income ratio in order to measure the operating efficiency of the Group. Management&#8217;s target for the trading cost-to-income ratio was to achieve sustained further improvements from the level of 45% which was first achieved in 2008 prior to the impact of the transfer of Alliance &amp; Leicester plc. In the first half of 2010, this target was met and the cost-to-income ratio reduced to 39%.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">3.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: -36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Profit for the period</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Profit for the period is the statutory consolidated profit after tax for the period. Discussion and analysis of this data is set out in this Business Review &#8211; Summary section on pages 4 to 7.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews the profit for the period in order to monitor the effectiveness of the Group&#8217;s strategy and to increase the strength of its capital base and its capacity to pay dividends to its shareholder Banco Santander, S.A.. Management&#8217;s target for the profit for the period was to achieve sustained growth over the previous period, and this has been achieved in the first half of 2010.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td colspan="2" valign="top" width="84%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">In order to ensure that targets related to the above three key performance indicators were met, management also evaluated other measures which are set out below as critical drivers towards achieving the three key performance indicators above on a sustainable basis.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">4.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: -36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Commercial Banking margin</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Commercial Banking margin is defined as trading net interest income (adjusted to remove net interest income from the run-down Alliance &amp; Leicester treasury asset portfolio) over average commercial assets (mortgages, unsecured personal loans, corporate loans and overdrafts). Discussion and analysis of this data is set out in the Business Review on pages 10 to 17.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews the Commercial Banking margin in order to assess the economic sustainability of its commercial banking products and operations. Management&#8217;s target for the Commercial Banking margin is to ensure that it is appropriate for the current market conditions and profit targets. This target was met in the period ended 30 June 2010 by virtue of balanced growth in customer assets and liabilities, the improvements in the margin and reported profit growth.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">5.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Total number of employees</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Total number of employees is measured at the period-end and calculated on an FTE basis. The total number of employees at 30 June 2010 on an FTE basis was 18,581 (31 December 2009: 19,483). As part of the planning process, headcount targets are set for each division and reviewed on a monthly basis.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews the total number of employees in order to support the continuing overall control of the Group&#8217;s cost base and the trading cost-to-income ratio. Management&#8217;s targets for the total number of employees are to ensure that staffing levels are optimal for the nature and size of the Group&#8217;s business. In 2010, headcount was reduced by 902 full-time equivalents. Of this reduction, 458 arose from the sale of James Hay. The remainder reflected the continued integration of the Bradford &amp; Bingley savings business and Alliance &amp; Leicester. This has been partially offset by investment in areas of the business identified for growth, particularly Corporate Banking and Global Banking &amp; Markets.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">6.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Market share of mortgage stock</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Market share of mortgage stock represents the book value of the Group&#8217;s mortgage asset as a percentage of the total book value of mortgages in the UK market, and is measured at the period-end. Market share of mortgage stock is calculated by reference to data on the size of the UK mortgage market produced by the Bank of England. Discussion and analysis of this data is set out in the Business Review on page 11.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews market share of mortgage stock as one of the measures to assess the Group&#8217;s effectiveness in obtaining new customers. Management&#8217;s target for market share of mortgage stock is to maintain or grow modestly the Group&#8217;s historical market share of mortgage stock, subject to earning an appropriate margin. In 2010, market share increased by 0.3% to 13.5% at 30 June 2010, driven by profitable new business and successful retention strategies.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">7.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Loan-to-deposit ratio</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management places a significant emphasis on the loan-to-deposit ratio as part of its focus on maintaining a sustainable funding model. The loan-to-deposit ratio represents the book value of the Group&#8217;s commercial assets (i.e. retail, corporate and private banking assets) divided by its commercial liabilities (i.e. retail, corporate and private banking deposits) and shareholders&#8217; equity, and is measured at the period-end.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews the loan-to-deposit ratio in order to assess the Group&#8217;s ability to fund its commercial operations with commercial borrowings, reducing reliance on sourcing funding from the wholesale markets while improving its customer product holdings. Management&#8217;s target for the loan-to-deposit ratio is sustained improvements in future years. During 2010, Santander UK has continued to achieve strong commercial net lending growth of 5% which has been more than matched by a larger (11%) increase in net deposit flows, resulting in a further improvement in our loan-to-deposit ratio to 124% (31 December 2009: 126%).</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">8.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Loan-to-value (&#8216;LTV&#8217;) ratio on mortgage stock (indexed)</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">As a result of the difficult economic environment, management places a significant emphasis on the LTV ratio on mortgage stock in order to ensure that the profit target be achieved. The LTV ratio is calculated as the book value of the Group&#8217;s residential mortgages as a percentage of the estimated current market value of the properties against which the mortgages are secured. The current market value is estimated from house price indices by adjusting the value of the property at the time of the origination of the mortgage for changes in house prices from that date to the balance sheet date. The LTV ratio is a measure of the estimated current level of security that the Group possesses on its mortgage loans. Discussion and analysis of this data is set out in the Risk Management Report on pages 41 and 42.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews the LTV ratio in order to assess the Group&#8217;s potential resilience to future declines in property prices. Management's target for the LTV ratio is, subject to market conditions, to sustain a LTV ratio of less than 60%.&#160;&#160;During 2010, the Group has continued to focus on the quality of new mortgage lending based on affordability and lower LTV segments of the market. The average LTV on stock value at 30 June 2010 was slightly lower than the previous year at 51% (31 December 2009: 52%) principally due to the effects of house price increases in the first half of the year.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">9.</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Risk weighted assets</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Risk weighted assets are a measure of a bank&#8217;s assets adjusted for their associated risks. Risk weightings are established in accordance with the Basel Capital Accord as implemented by the UK Financial Services Authority.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Management reviews risk weighted assets in order to determine how the regulatory capital of the Group is being utilised, and to understand risk-adjusted trends of the Group&#8217;s assets. &#160;Management&#8217;s target for risk weighted assets is for modest growth consistent with maintaining a strong Tier 1 ratio. &#160;</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">As at June 2010, risk weighted assets of &#163;67,913m increased by 0.7% since 31 December 2009, driven by the growth in commercial assets of 2%, offset by the impact of continued de-leveraging of the Alliance &amp; Leicester treasury asset portfolio.&#160;</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Trading profit before tax by segment</font></div>

</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="8%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">(356)</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">(31)</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="11%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">-</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="8%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">-</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">-</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="7%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">(387)</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="28%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading profit/(loss) before tax</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">1,113</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">152</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="11%">

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Six months ended 30 June 2010 compared to six months ended 30 June 2009</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Trading profit before tax of &#163;1,125m increased by &#163;155m on the first half of the previous year (2009: &#163;970m), driven by strong income growth, flat expenses and reduced impairment losses.</font></div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Retail Banking trading profit before tax increased by &#163;373m to &#163;1,113m (2009: &#163;740m), driven by a strong increase in trading income and a reduction in costs resulting from the integration benefits of Alliance &amp; Leicester.&#160;&#160;Trading income benefited as more customers reverted to standard variable rate mortgages, and margins on new and retained business improved in both the mortgage and unsecured loan portfolios in the low interest environment.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Retail Banking business delivered strong growth in customer deposits, together with growth in bank account liability balances, and benefited from existing hedging strategies which helped to reduce the impact of lower interest rates on the deposit book.&#160;&#160;These positive income trends were partly offset by lower fee income from sales of structur
ed investment products, lower fees on unsecured lending products in line with lower new business volumes and lower personal protection insurance.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Corporate Banking trading profit before tax&#160;increased by &#163;25m to &#163;152m (2009: &#163;127m). This movement was due to a strong income performance and lower operating expenses benefiting from integration synergies, partially offset by slightly higher impairment losses. The increased trading income was largely driven by exceptional growth in deposit balances. In addition, there has been increased lending to the UK SME market through the network of 25 Corporate Business Centres with growth in lending balances of over 20%, as well as the benefit of changes to transfer pricing arrangements (applied since 2009).</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Global Banking &amp; Markets trading profit before tax decreased by &#163;58m to &#163;159m (2009: &#163;217m). Trading income decreased, reflecting the non-recurrence of particularly favourable market conditions in the first half of 2009, as well as a weaker performance in the short-term markets business, which suffered due to a less favourable trading environment as a result of spread volatility on government bonds and more difficult liquidity conditions.&#160;&#160;In addition, trading costs increased, reflecting ongoing investment initiatives relating to new products, markets and customer segments.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Private Banking trading profit before tax increased by &#163;9m to &#163;48m (2009: &#163;39m).&#160;&#160;This movement was due to a strong income performance resulting from increased customer deposits year-on-year, as well as the benefit of changes to transfer pricing arrangements (applied since 2009).</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Group Infrastructure trading loss before tax increased by &#163;194m to &#163;347m (2009: &#163;153m), reflecting an increase in funding costs during the year including a higher cost of liquid assets held (which have increased to &#163;31bn) and medium-term funding, and non-recurrence of certain one-off benefits, including the returns on Bradford &amp; Bingley funds acquired late in 2008.&#160;&#160;In addition, trading costs increased, largely reflecting one-off expenditure relating to the rebranding of Abbey and the Bradford &amp; Bingley savings business in January 2010.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Business volumes</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Business volumes are set out below. These volumes are used by management to assess the sales performance of the Group, both absolutely and relative to its UK peers, and to inform management of product trends in the market.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="65%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.75pt solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="10%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.75pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">2010</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="10%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.75pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">2009</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="65%">

</td>

</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="10%">

<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>

<div>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr valign="top">
<td style="WIDTH: 28.35pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">&#160; </font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Main highlights for the six months to 30 June 2010 (compared to the same period in 2009 unless otherwise stated) include:</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Gross mortgage lending of &#163;12.3bn, with an estimated market share of 19.3%, was ahead of the same period last year and ahead of our market share of mortgage stock, with a continued focus on the quality of new lending based on affordability and lower loan to value (&#8216;LTV&#8217;) segments. The average LTV on new business completions in the first half of 2010 was 61% versus 59% in the first half of 2009.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Capital repayments of &#163;9.0bn were broadly in line with the same period last year.&#160;&#160;Our estimated market share of capital repayments increased to 14.6%, reflecting the smaller market size in 2010. This performance was achieved against a market backdrop of heightened competition in low LTV segments, demonstrating effective retention strategies in key segments.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Net mortgage lending of &#163;3.3bn exceeded prior year net lending, as the Group continues to be a consistent lender in difficult times.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Net deposit inflows of &#163;4.6bn were broadly in line with last year, with a strong performance in Retail and Private Banking offset by a weaker performance from the Corporate Banking business. Retail Banking delivered strong inflows, in increasingly competitive market conditions, and benefited from the alignment of product marketing and pricing strategies across the brands, including the introduction of formerly Abbey-branded products, such as fixed rate bonds and Individual Savings Accounts, a strong ISA season and promotional activity in the former Bradford &amp; Bingley branches. In addition, there was an 11% increase in bank account liabilities. Corporate Banking flows were positive despite a difficult economic environment, with a favourable maturity profile.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Investment sales - API of &#163;1.8bn were in line with 2009, as we continued to cross sell our investment products to our savings base which has deepened our customer relationships albeit in a difficult market.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">The number of bank account openings was marginally higher than last year, maintaining the trend of previous quarters and on track to achieve over 1 million openings by the year-end. This was a significant achievement given the campaign in the first half of 2009 (5% in-credit balances) was not repeated in the first half of 2010. A further campaign is planned for the second half in 2010. In addition, in the first half of 2010, the loyalty strategy contributed to approximately 150,000 Zero Current Account openings.&#160;&#160;The proportion of adult bank accounts has remained high which, in part, drove the liability increase.&#160;&#160;The current account is viewed by Santander UK as a key relationship product in the UK, as it is the driver of cross-selling opportunities and is therefore an area of focus throughout the branch network.</font></div>


<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&#160;</font></div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Credit card sales for which we have focused on lower risk customers were higher than in the first half of 2009, driven by a strong performance in telephone and internet sales, and the success achieved with the Zero Credit Card, of which approximately 160,000 have been opened in the year to date.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="79%" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Total gross unsecured personal lending (&#8216;UPL&#8217;) decreased to &#163;0.7bn, representing a 19% decrease from 2009, following the same trend as the previous year and reflecting our cautious stance, with the unsecured loan portfolio balance down 21% on 2009.&#160;&#160;We continue to focus on lending to existing customers with a strong, established credit history.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Retail Banking</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Retail Banking offers a comprehensive range of banking products and related financial services (residential mortgages, savings and banking, and other personal financial services products) to customers throughout the UK. It serves customers through the Santander UK and Alliance &amp; Leicester networks of branches and ATMs, as well as through telephone and internet channels.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

</div>

<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>

<div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%">
<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Retail Banking trading profit before tax</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Six months ended 30 June 2010 compared to six months ended 30 June 2009</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Trading profit before tax increased by &#163;373m to &#163;1,113m (2009: &#163;740m).&#160;&#160;By income statement line, the movements were:</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="73%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading net interest income increased by &#163;347m to &#163;1,838m (2009: &#163;1,491m), largely driven by balanced growth in customer lending (up 5%) and deposits (up 6%) across a mix of products combined with effective margin management. A key driver was income from existing mortgage balances increasing as more customers reverted to standard variable rate mortgages in the current low interest rate environment and new and retained business margins improved in both the mortgage and unsecured loan portfolios more than offsetting the higher cost of retail deposits. In terms of mortgage lending, the Group achieved a 19% share of the gross mortgage lending market in the UK in the first half of 2010 (higher than the 2009 share of 17%), with lending written at margins above stock margin and with a continued emphasis on targeting lower loan-to-value s
egments. In addition, net interest income growth benefited from an 11% growth in bank account liability balances and existing hedging strategies which helped to reduce the impact of lower interest rates on the deposit book.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="73%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading non-interest income decreased by &#163;16m to &#163;330m (2009: &#163;346m), largely due to lower investment fees reflecting lower new business commissions in the sustained low rate environment combined with the mix of sales shifting away from structured investment products towards managed funds (which will yield a trail income in future periods rather than an upfront commission).&#160;&#160;In addition, unsecured lending related fees reduced, driven by lower volumes (down 19%), and mortgage fees were adversely affected by lower redemption volumes impacting the sector.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="73%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading expenses of &#163;699m decreased by &#163;33m (2009: &#163;732m). The decrease in administrative expenses was largely due to the removal of duplication across back office and support functions due to the integration of Alliance &amp; Leicester and the Bradford &amp; Bingley savings business. Savings have also been achieved through review and renegotiation of contracts benefiting from procurement savings of the Banco Santander, S.A. group, and tight management control of costs. These savings were partially offset by increased depreciation as a result of continued investment in IT systems and in the integration of Alliance &amp; Leicester and the Bradford &amp; Bingley savings business.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="73%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Impairment losses on loans and advances of &#163;356m decreased by &#163;9m from &#163;365m in the first half of 2010, with the largest decrease relating to mortgages. Although mortgage non-performing loans continued to increase (&#163;78m increase compared to 31 December 2009), there has been a significant reduction in the growth rate of the non-performing loans observed in 2010 when compared to the growth rate experienced in 2009 (3% growth in the first half of 2010 relative to the second half of 2009 versus 52% in the first half of 2009 relative to the second half of 2008). This improving performance in difficult market conditions has been delivered as a result of three factors: credit quality of a high quality mortgage book, effective collection handling and the slight upturn in house prices in a low interest rate environment. Similarly, per
formance across the unsecured portfolios has also improved in the year to date.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Retail Banking segment balances</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="73%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">At 30 June 2010, customer assets of &#163;168.4bn were 5% higher than the same point in 2009 (2% higher than at 31 December 2009) reflecting the growth in mortgage balances. &#160;This was driven by continued strong growth in gross mortgage lending, where market share was 19% (compared to stock share of 14%), and success in retention activities.&#160;Gross lending remains focused on quality based on affordability and lower LTVs segments. &#160;Partly offsetting this growth has been the continued reduction in UPL balances, down 21%, where the focus has been on lending to existing customers with proven repayment track records.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="9%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="73%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">At 30 June 2010, customer deposits increased 6% to &#163;113.7bn compared to 30 June 2009 (3% higher than at 31 December 2009) benefiting from strong inflows in the six months, in an increasingly competitive market. &#160;The ISA season in 2010 was particularly successful, while a focus on bank accounts, and specifically higher value, primary accounts, resulted in an 11% increase in bank account liabilities.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Corporate Banking</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Corporate Banking provides a range of banking services principally to small and mid-sized (&#8216;SME&#8217;) UK companies (with turnover between &#163;1m and &#163;25m) through its network of Corporate Business Centres and specialist businesses. A broad range of banking products is offered including loans, bank accounts, deposits, treasury services, asset finance, cash transmission, trade finance and invoice discounting. The specialist businesses within Corporate Banking service customers in various business sectors including Real Estate, Social Housing, and Infrastructure. Corporate Banking is also responsible for managing the run down of certain acquired Alliance &amp; Leicester treasury portfolios.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

</td>

<td align="left" valign="top" width="57%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.75pt solid">

</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.75pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">19.4</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="top" width="14%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.75pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">18.8</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">(1) Excludes Alliance &amp; Leicester non-growth portfolios</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Corporate Banking trading profit before tax</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Six months ended 30 June 2010 compared to six months ended 30 June 2009</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Trading profit before tax increased by &#163;25m to &#163;152m (2009: &#163;127m).&#160;&#160;By income statement line, the movements were:</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="75%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading net interest income improved by &#163;43m to &#163;193m (2009: &#163;150m). The increase in net interest income in 2010 was primarily driven by exceptional growth in deposit balances (42% increase year on year) and the benefit of transfer pricing arrangements (applied since 2009).&#160;&#160;In addition, there has been increased lending to the UK SME market through the network of 25 Corporate Business Centres and growth in lending balances of over 20%, with margins improving.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="75%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading non-interest income decreased by &#163;13m to &#163;74m (2009: &#163;87m). The underlying treasury income in relation to derivatives sold to corporate customers was higher. However, this was offset by a smaller proportion of the income being recognised in this segment.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="75%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading expenses of &#163;84m were &#163;7m lower than the previous year (2009: &#163;91m). The decrease was due to operational efficiencies arising from the integration of Alliance &amp; Leicester, partially offset by investment in the Corporate Business Centre network. The investment includes hiring of an additional staff of 127 on an FTE basis over the last twelve months and an increase of 70% in the floor space of the Corporate Business Centre network.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="75%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Impairment losses on loans and advances of &#163;31m increased by &#163;12m from &#163;19m in the first half of 2009. The increase of &#163;12m reflected growth in asset balances and some deterioration arising from market conditions.&#160;&#160;The run-down Alliance &amp; Leicester Corporate portfolios continue to perform in line with our original expectations with provisions raised in 2008 still expected to cover losses inherent in the portfolios.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Corporate Banking segment balances</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="75%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">At 30 June 2010, core customer assets of &#163;19.6bn were 11% higher than the same point in 2009 (4% higher than at 31 December 2009) driven by a strong performance via our 25 Corporate Business Centres and a broader product offering. &#160;We have continued to build on our growing SME franchise, with lending to this group totalling &#163;7.5bn up over 20% since 30 June 2009 (up 12% compared to 31 December 2009).</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="75%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Customer deposits increased 42% to &#163;19.4bn compared to 30 June 2009 impacted by increased competition in this market. &#160;Net flows for the six months ended 30 June 2010 were positive with a favourable maturity profile.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Global Banking &amp; Markets</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Global Banking &amp; Markets is a financial markets business focused on providing value added financial services to large corporates not serviced by Corporate Banking (being, in general, very large multinationals and financial institutions, as well as to the rest of Santander UK&#8217;s business (including the Retail Banking and Corporate Banking divisions).</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Global Banking &amp; Markets trading profit before tax</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Six months ended 30 June 2010 compared to six months ended 30 June 2009</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Trading profit before tax decreased by &#163;58m to &#163;159m (2009: &#163;217m).&#160;&#160;By income statement line, the movements were:</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
<div id="FTR">
<div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>

<div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
<hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
</div>
</div>

<div id="HDR">
<div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; </font></div>
</div>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="74%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 2.05pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading non-interest income of &#163;221m decreased by &#163;41m from &#163;262m in the first half of 2009, reflecting the non-recurrence of particularly favourable market conditions in the first half of 2009, as well as a weaker performance in the short-term markets business, which suffered due to a less favourable trading environment as a result of spread volatility on government bonds and more difficult liquidity conditions.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="74%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 2.05pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading expenses of &#163;62m increased by &#163;17m (2009: &#163;45m), reflecting ongoing investment initiatives relating to new products, markets and customer segments.&#160;&#160;There has been a 36% increase in headcount, across the customer transaction businesses and the new Gilt Edge Market Making desk.</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">&#160;</font><br>
&#160;</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Private Banking</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Private Banking offers private banking and other specialist banking services in the UK through the Group&#8217;s majority interest in Santander Private Banking UK Limited, and offshore banking through Abbey National International Limited, Alliance &amp; Leicester International Limited, and Bradford &amp; Bingley International Limited.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" width="59%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&#160; </font></td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 3.2pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Six months ended</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 3.2pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">30 June 2010</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 3.2pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&#163;m</font></div>
</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 3.2pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Six months ended</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 3.2pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">30 June 2009</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 3.2pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&#163;m</font></div>

</td>
<td align="right" valign="bottom" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 3.2pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">14.2</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">&#160;</font><br>
&#160;</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Private Banking trading profit before tax</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Six months ended 30 June 2010 compared to six months ended 30 June 2009</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Trading profit before tax increased by &#163;9m to &#163;48m (2009: &#163;39m).&#160;&#160;By income statement line, the movements were:</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="74%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.9pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading net interest income increased by &#163;9m to &#163;63m (2009: &#163;54m). The increase was primarily due to increased customer deposits year-on-year through both Cater Allen and Abbey International with the benefit of transfer pricing arrangements (applied since 2009) which more than offset competitive market pressures on pricing.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="74%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.9pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading non-interest income of &#163;6m was in line with the first half of 2009.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="74%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.9pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Trading expenses of &#163;21m increased by &#163;1m (2009: &#163;20m), largely due to a move in premises during the period.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="bottom" width="74%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.9pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">Impairment losses on loans and advances of &#163;nil were broadly in line with the first half of 2009.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Private Banking segment balances</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">
<tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="8%">
<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">&gt;</font></div>
</td>
<td valign="top" width="74%">
<div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: arial">At 30 June 2010, customer deposits increased 15% to &#163;15.4bn compared to 30 June 2009 (8% higher than at 31 December 2009) benefiting from strong inflows in the six months, in an increasingly competitive market. &#160;Strong levels of new business were recorded in both Cater Allen and Abbey International, where balances were up 9% and 38% respectively year-on-year.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Group infrastructure</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">Group Infrastructure consists of Asset and Liability Management (&#8216;ALM&#8217;), which is also responsible for Group Capital and Funding, and the Alliance &amp; Leicester treasury asset portfolio.&#160; ALM is responsible for managing the Group&#8217;s structural balance sheet composition and, in conjunction with the Risk Division, strategic and tactical liquidity risk management. This includes short-term, medium-term, covered bond and securitisation funding programmes. ALM's responsibilities also include management of Retail Banking&#8217;s product and structural exposure to interest rates and, in that role, it is a link between Retail Banking and Global Banking &amp; Markets.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Arial">The negative income and expenses reflect the element of funding cost and expenses not recharged to the business.</font></div>

<div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br>
</div>

<td align="right" valign="top" width="11%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 0.5pt solid">

</td>
</tr><tr>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="58%">
